revised_title: Characterization of Imperfections in Type I and Type II Diamonds
tldr: The authors investigate the imperfections in type I and type II diamonds using transmission electron microscopy and find that type I diamonds contain nitrogen platelets on {100} planes, while type II diamonds do not. They also discover different types of imperfections common to both types of diamonds and propose that type II diamonds may have grown in nitrogen-free conditions or at lower temperatures than type I diamonds.
